WASHINGTON, DC – Yesterday, Congresswoman Carolyn B Maloney (D-NY) released the following statement after today’s vote on final passage of HR 7776, the James M Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023. “While there are admirable provisions within this bill, including language to address sexual assault in the military and to support Ukraine, I could not in good faith support final passage when this bill included over $40 billion in additional spending separate from President Biden’s initial budget request.

WASHINGTON, DC — At today’s Financial Services Committee hearing titled “The Need for Bold Investments in Fair and Affordable Housing to Combat Inflation,” Congresswoman Carolyn B Maloney (D-NY), senior member of the committee and co-author of the Affordable Housing Preservation Act, advocated on behalf of homeowners and renters as they deal with the impact of rising interest rates. During the hearing, Rep. Maloney stated, “Madam Chairwoman, I thank you for holding this hearing and I thank you for focusing on the need for more housing.
